title: Brixworth Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Kokai / Brixworth Country Park
images.caption: Brixworth Country Park. Seen from the picnic area looking NNE.

images.title: Kokai / Shoreline of Reservoir
images.caption: Shoreline of Reservoir. The shoreline referred to in the title is bottom right of the image. Yachts on Pitsford Water can be seen in the distance.

images.title: Kokai / Causeway, Pitsford Water.
images.caption: Causeway, Pitsford Water. The north end of Pitsford Water can be seen behind the causeway.

description: A circular cycle or walk around the expansive Brixworth Country Park in Northamptonshire. Pitsford Reservoir is the main feature of the park. It is  the 34th largest body of water in England and Wales and has a fabulous cycle and walking path running around the perimeter and a Nature Reserve at the northern end. There is also a sensory garden and a sculpture trail. The route below visits the pretty villages surrounding the reservoir including Brixworth, Walgrave and Scaldwell. Cycle hire is available at the western end of the park and there is also a cafe for refreshments. You can start the walk from the ample car park at postcode NN6 9DG for your sat navs. The park is located close to both Northampton and Wellingborough .
